text.p: Write MATLAB code that analyzes the numbers in the 2nd column of array m for whether they are odd or even. Create a column vector called oddoreven, and on the rows corresponding to rows in m enter 1 if the number is even and 0 if the number is odd. Use your understanding of loops and control flow to accomplish this task.
At the end of your code, be sure to display your oddoreven vector to answer the question below.
Tips: You may find the mod(), size(), and zeros() functions useful in this task (you can use help to look up info on the functions or use the Mathworks web help to find out more.

codeparam.grader_payload: %api_key=SolsRMsNeis %% answer = [1;0;1;0;0;0;1;1;1;0] assert(~isempty(whos('oddoreven')), 'You must create a variable ''oddoreven''') %% assert(isequal(oddoreven, answer), 'The vector oddoreven should contain 1 on rows that are even in m, and 0 on rows that are odd in m.') %%
